isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - AIR FITTINGS - COMPRESSION TYPE FITTING

warning.para: A sudden release of air pressure can cause personal injury or damage to equipment. To prevent injury or equipment damage, exhaust the vehicle air tanks.

caution.para: Small air lines are available in 1/8 inch or 5/32 inch sizes. Make sure 1/8 inch air lines are used with 1/8 inch fittings and 5/32 inch air lines are used with 5/32 inch fittings. Mixing sizes can cause air leaks or damage to fittings.

step1.para: Exhaust the vehicle air tanks before continuing.
Loosen the nut on the fitting, and slide it back out of the way.
Pull the air line and attached collet from the fitting.
Inspect the fitting, air line and collet, and nut for damage or wear. Replace as necessary ( Figure 5).
Check the threads of the fitting for thread sealant. If no sealant is present, apply Loctite 242 or equivalent.

caution.para: Do not overtighten the nut. Overtightening can compress the collet too much and cause an air line restriction.

step1.para: Install the air line, collet, and nut. If installing a new fitting, place the collet in the fitting and loosely install the nut. (Do not tighten the nut at this time.) Insert the air line through the nut and into the collet. Tighten the nut.
